submissions.name: How MIT brainpower returned a dancer to the stage
submissions.creator: The Boston Globe
submissions.description: "BioM, a Bedford company founded in 2007 by an MIT professor, has created a prosthetic ankle that supplies power during walking and produces a more natural gait. The ankle is fitted based on the amputeeâ€™s ideal stride, to minimize gait abnormalities that lead to health problems." In this interactive the user can see how the prosthetic ankle works at different stages of a stride.
